alert.note: Alert for Pima (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 12 at 1:47PM MST until September 12 at 3:45PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tucson has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... East Central Pima County in southeastern Arizona... * Until 345 PM MST. * At 147 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain near and southeast of Ryan Field. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Drexel Heights, Three Points, Pascua Pueblo Yaqui Reservation, Valencia West, Tucson Estates and Ryan AirField. This includes the following streams and drainages... West Branch Santa Cruz River, Santa Cruz River and Brawley Wash. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
